section.section: The Commission shall consist of 15 members appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate.

Of the 15 members:
Nine shall be individuals who do not have any connection with the management or policy of a health care provider or payor; and
Of the remaining six members:
Two shall be physicians;
Two shall be payors, as defined in § 19-132 of this subtitle;
One shall be a nursing home administrator in the State; and
One shall be a nonphysician health care practitioner.
The term of a member is 4 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Commission on October 1, 1999.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
The Governor may remove a member for neglect of duty, incompetence, or misconduct.
A member may not serve more than two consecutive terms.

text.section:
When appointing members to the Commission, the Governor shall:
Assure that:
At least five members are residents of different counties with a population of 300,000 or more; and
At least three members are residents of different counties with a population of less than 300,000, of which at least:
One shall be a resident of the Eastern Shore;
One shall be a resident of Allegany County, Garrett County, Washington County, Carroll County, or Frederick County; and
One shall be a resident of Southern Maryland; and
To the extent practicable, assure geographic balance and promote racial, ethnic, and gender diversity in the Commission's membership.
